diagnostic_meta.precheck: There are a few basic checks which should be made on the C64 when troubleshooting a system with NO VIDEO ON POWER UP. Although there are several things which may cause this symptom, these preliminary checks will eliminate some of the more common failures.
diagnostic_meta.system_power_supply: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 power supply circuits. When referring to this section, it is assumed that from the 'Preliminary Basic Checks 1-3', there is a problem with one or more of the + 5VDC CAN, +5 VDC or +12 VDC supplies.
diagnostic_meta.system_reset: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 RESET circuits. When referring to this section, it is assumed from the basic preliminary check, PRE-CHECK 4, that there is a problem with the system RESET.
diagnostic_meta.system_clocks: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 CLOCK circuits. When referring to this section, it is assumed from the basic preliminary checks, PRE-CHECK 5-8, that there is a problem with one, or more, of the 1 MHZ, 14.3 MHZ, or 8.18 MHZ system clocks.
diagnostic_meta.system_video: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 VIDEO circuits. When referring to this section, it is assumed from the basic preliminary checks, PRE-CHECK 9-11, that there is a problem with one or more of the video outputs.
diagnostic_meta.system_ram: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 user RAM area. Bad RAM ICs are a common problem when the system does not produce a screen on Power-Up. It is not uncommon to have more than 1 RAM IC failure.
diagnostic_meta.system_rom_io: This section covers procedures for troubleshooting the C64 ROM Selection and I/O Decoding. This area is a common problem when the system does not produce a screen on System Power Ups

precheck.test: Is the signal on pin 24 of IC U5 equal to +5V DC?
Is the signal on pin 40 of IC U19 equal to +5V DC?
Is the signal on pin 13 of IC U19 equal to +12V DC?
Is the RESET signal on pin 40 of IC U7 equal to 0V DC on System Power Up to +5V DC in approximately 1 second?
Is the ØCOLOR signal on pin 21 of IC U19 equal to 14.3 MHZ?
Is the ØIN signal on pin 22 of IC U19 equal to 8.18 MHZ?
Is the ØOIN signal on pin 1 of IC U7 equal to 1.0 MHZ?
Is the Ø2 signal on pin 39 of IC U7 equal to 1.0 MHZ?
Is the COMPOSITE signal on pin 4 of connector CN5 approximately +2V DC Composite?
Is the LUMINANCE signal on pin 1 of connector CN5 approximately +1V DC Luminance?
Is the COLOR signal on pin 6 of connector CN5 approximately +1V DC Color?

system_power_supply.test: Is the output signal on pin 2 of voltage regulator VR2 equal to +5V DC?
Is the input signal on pin 1 of voltage regulator VR2 equal to +9 to +12 DC?
Is the AC IN signal on pins 4 and 6 of rectifier CR4 equal to 9V to 12V AC?
Is the AC IN signal just on pin 4 of rectifier CR4 equal to 9V to 12V AC?
Is the AC IN signal just on pin 6 of rectifier CR4 equal to 9V to 12V AC?
Is the AC IN signal on pins 4 and 6 of rectifier CR4 NOT equal to 9V to 12V AC?
Is the AC IN signal on pin 6 of connector CN7 equal to 9 to 12V AC?
Is the AC IN signal on pin 7 of connector CN7 equal to 9 to 12V AC?
Is the output signal on pin 2 of voltage regulator VR1 equal to +12V DC?
Is the input signal on pin 1 of voltage regulator VR1 equal to +15V to +18V DC?
Is the signal at the anode of diode CR6 equal to 9V to 12V AC Riding on a +9V to + 12V DC Level?
Is the signal at the anode of diode CR6 equal to 9V to 12V AC Only?
Is the signal at the anode of diode CR6 equal to +9V to +12V DC Only?
Is the signal on the + side of capacitor C91 equal to + 5V DC?
Is the + 5V DC signal on pin 5 of connector CN7 equal to +5V DC?

system_reset.test: Is the output signal on pin 9 of IC U20 equal to +5V DC on System Power Up to 0V DC in approximately 1 second?
Is RESET signal on pin 40 of IC U7 equal to 0V DC on System Power up to +5V DC in approximately 1 Second?

system_clocks.test: Is the input signal on pin 13 of IC U31 equal to 14.3 MHZ?
Is the input signal on pin 21 of IC U19 equal to 14.3 MHZ?
Is the input signal on pin 11 of IC U29 equal to 2.0 MHZ?
Is the input signal on pin 1 of IC U32 equal to 1.0 MHZ?
Is the input signal on pin 1 of IC U7 equal to 1.0 MHZ?
Is the signal on the BASE of transistor Q7 equal to +2V to +3V DC?
Is the input signal on pin 9 of IC U32 equal to +1.5V to + 2V DC?
Is the input signal on pin 2 of IC U31 equal to + 2V to + 3V DC?
Is the input signal on pin 22 of IC U19 equal to 8.18 MHZ?
Is the output signal on pin 39 of IC U7 equal to 1.0 MHZ?

system_video.test: Is the SYNC/LUM signal on pin 15 of IC U19 equal to +5V DC Composite?
Is the C/S signal on pin 10 of IC U19 equal to +5V DC with a Negative Pulse ONCE on system Reset?
Is the R/W signal on pin 11 of IC U19 equal to +5V DC with a negative Pulse ONCE on system Reset?

error.diagnostic: Defective U19, U1 7, U7, U6, U1 U2, U9-U12, U21-U24

system_video.test: Is the COLOR signal on pin 14 of IC U19 equal to +2V DC Color on a +5V to +6V DC Level?
Is the COMPOSITE signal on pin 4 of connector CNS equal to +2V DC Composite?
Is the LUMINANCE signal on pin 1 of connector CN5 equal to +1V DC Sync/Lum?
Is the COLOR signal on pin 6 of connector CN5 equal to +1V DC Color?

system_ram.test: With power applied to the system, feel ICs U9-U12, U21-U24. One or more are extremely hot?
Is the DATA signal on pin 2 of each IC U9-U12, U21-U24 equal to +5V DC Immediately on Power Up? These DATA signals MUST GO TO A STRONG + 5 VDC LEVEL IMMEDIATELY when power is applied to the system.
Is the CASRAM signal on pin 15 of ICs U9-U12, U21-U24 equal to + 5V DC Pulse?
Cut pin 18 CASRAM of IC U17 and measure the signal on CUT PIN. Is the signal equal to + 5V DC Pulse?
Is the R/W signal on pin 3 of ICs U9-U12, U21-U24 equal to +5V DC with a Negative Pulse ONCE on system Reset?

error.diagnostic: Defective U9-U1 2, U21-U24, U17, U7, U1, U2

system_ram.test: Is the RAS signal on pin 4 of ICs U9-U12, U21-U24 equal to +2V DC Pulse?
Is the output signal on pins 1, 7, 9, 12 of IC U13 equal to + 5V DC Pulse?
Is the input signal on pins 2, 3, 5, 6, 10, 11, 13, 14 of IC U13 equal to +5V DC Pulse?
Is the C/S ENABLE signal on pins 1 and 15 of IC U13 equal to +5V DC Pulse?
Is the C/S ENABLE signal incorrect on pin 1?

success.diagnostic: Defective U17, U19, U14, U13, U25

system_ram.test: Is the C/S ENABLE signal incorrect on pin 15?

success.diagnostic: Defective U17, U19, U14, U13, U25, U26, U27, U6, U8

system_ram.test: Cut pin 8, +5V DC, of IC U9-U12 and U21-U24 one at a time and measure the incorrect signal from Step 6 after each cut. Is the result equal to +5V DC Pulse?
Are the incorrect signals of IC U13 on pin 2, 5, 11, 14?
Are the incorrect signals of IC U13 on pin 3, 6, 10, 13?
Cut pin 24, +5V DC. of ICs U3, U4, U5 one at a time and measure the incorrect signal from Step 7.3 after each cut. Are the signals +5V DC Pulse?
Is the output signal on pins 4, 7, 9, 12 of IC U25 equal to + 5V DC Pulse?
Is input signal on pins 2, 3, 5, 6, 10, 11, 13, 14 of iC U25 equal to +5V DC Pulse?
Cut pin 8, + 5V DC, of ICs U9-U12, U21-U24 one at a time and measure the incorrect signal from Step 8 after each cut. Are the signals +5V DC Pulse?
Cut pin 24, +5V DC, of ICs U3, U4, U5 one at a time and measure the incorrect signal from Step 9 after each cut. Are the signals +5V DC Pulse?
Are the signals incorrect on pins 3, 6, 1O, 13?

success.diagnostic: Defective U25, U7, U26, U6, U1, U2

system_ram.test: Are the signals incorrect on pins 2, 5, 11, 14?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the CHAR ROM SELECT signal on pin 15 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC with negative pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the KERN ROM SELECT signal on pin 16 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC with Negative Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the BASIC ROM SELECT signal on pin 17 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC with Negative Pulse on system Reset?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the l/O ENABLE signal on pin 12 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC with Negative Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is ADDRESSES 12-15 on pins 2, 3, 4, 27 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC Pulse?

error.diagnostic: Defective U17, U7, U13, U26, U27, U6, U8

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the CHAREN, HIRAM, LORAM signals on pins 6, 7, 8 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the ROM L signal on pin 11 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the CASRAM signal on pin 18 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Cut pin 1 8, CASRAM, of IC U17 and measure the signal on the cut pin. Is the signal equal to +5V DC Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the VA12, VA13 on pins 20, 21 of IC U17 equal to +5V DC Pulse?

error.diagnostic: Defective U17, U19, U26, U9-U12, U21-U24

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the EXROM signal on pin 23 of IC U17 equal to 0V DC?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the R/W signal on pin 24 of IC U17 +5V DC with Negative Pulse ONCE on system Reset?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the AEC signal on pin 25 of IC U17 equal to + 5V DC Pulse?

system_rom_io.description: SYSTEM ROM SELECTION AND I/O DECODING
system_rom_io.test: Is the BA signal on pin 26 of IC U17 equal to + 5V DC Pulse?

success.diagnostic: There is no possible way to cover 100% of the problems that may arise internal to the C64. The checks given in this manual basically cover problems where even the diagnostic does not produce a screen on system power-up. Please refer to this Youtube Playlist to learn more about how to troubleshoot C64 problems.
